 The systems have completely proprietary functions and software. The team currently has about 12 employees who have extensive experience with the overall system and security responsibility.
   

  

 We operate in a fast and dynamic world where we dare to take on challenges continuously. We are a solution-oriented team that helps each other and together we create our way forward to achieve a sustainable transport industry.
   

  

**What We Hope To Find In Your CV**
* Bachelor's or Master of Science in Engineering or equivalent experience in system development of embedded systems.
* Good knowledge of software development for real-time systems.
* Previous experience working with ISO26262 or equivalent standards from other product development.
* Knowledge and experience of methods in functional safety work such as HARA, FMEA, FTA etc.
* Good oral and written proficiency in Swedish and English.


**For more information**
 Call me, Johan Christensson, hiring manager, at +46736686397, or my colleague Åsa Ångman at +46700860637. You can also email us at johan.christensson@scania.com. You can also call my colleague, Patrik Neckman who is in charge of the recruitment process itself at +46737269409 if you are wondering anything about the recruitment process.
   

  

**Application**
 If you feel you have a fair share of the skills for this interesting role, please apply by submitting your CV and certificates by May 5th. Please send your application as soon as possible, screening and interviews will be done continuously.
   

  

 If you possess some (not necessarily all) of the requirements mentioned, we encourage you to apply with confidence. Every application is valued, and we welcome you to join us on this exciting journey of sustainability-driven innovation. Your unique skills and experiences could be a perfect fit for our team!
   

  

 At Scania, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles! We hire for attitude and train for skills.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

 We are looking forward to your application!
   

  

 We will not post this job ad on any other job portals than the ones that are affiliated with Scania nor will we hire a consultant for this role, hence we don’t want sales calls or e-mails regarding this please.
   

  

 Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2020, we delivered 66,900 trucks, 5,200 buses as well as 11,000 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 125 billion, of which over 20 percent were services-related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 55,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com.
   

  

 key words: FuSa, ADAS

title: Lead Value Engineer
description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.
   

  

**The Team:**
 As a
 **Lead Value Engineer** 
 you'll be joining our Nordics Value Engineering function, based in Copenhagen. This function is part of the wider Value Engineering organisation at Celonis. The position of Value Engineer is a trusted advisor helping customers achieve their strategic goals and realise significant value using the Celonis Execution Management System. A Value Engineer has full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers – landing, expanding, adopting and renewing. Responsibilities include translating customers’ objectives into value assessments or proof-of-value projects, building specific Celonis business cases and demos, running value workshops, and engaging with multiple senior stakeholders to deliver value driven results and secure long term partnership agreements.
   

  

**The Role:**
 As a
 **Lead** 
**Value Engineer** 
 you are spearheading our mission of data-driven business transformation with our customers. You will work in partnership with the Celonis Sales Teams and have full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers. You are our customers trusted advisor and help them achieve their strategic goals and realize significant value using Celonis EMS. In collaboration with our partners and Celonis Services, you will drive measurable business impact across various processes and industries and accelerate the adoption of our platform. You will blend deep process and industry expertise with a proven consulting skill set with strong analytical skills at the forefront of one of the fastest-growing tech companies worldwide.
   

  

**The work you’ll do:**
**Identify & Frame Value**
* Discover and translate customers’ strategic priorities into high-impact Celonis use cases
* Build demos and business cases, leveraging industry benchmarks and best practices in order to win new customers
* Undertake Value Assessments or Proof-of-Value Projects and communicate the value opportunity and strategic roadmap to C-Level executives


**Realize Value**
* Facilitate business value workshops and use Celonis to identify and qualify opportunities for process enhancement
* Derive improvement measures in core business functions and initiate improvement actions and enterprise-wide change initiatives
* Present results and realized value to senior management and C-level executives


**Scale Value**
* Responsible for the end-to-end customer value journey, landing, expanding, adoption and renewing
* Build a strategic expansion roadmap for customers embedding Celonis EMS as a strategic business transformation platform in their organization and therefore drive adoption and expansion
* Provide feedback to our product development teams to enhance the Celonis platform and Apps based on new use cases


**The qualifications you need:**
* Live for Customer Value: Several years experience in an analytical role with the objective to demonstrate or secure value through business data analysis / analytics, business process improvement and respective Software deployment . Ideally in a customer-facing role in Solution Consulting, Sales Engineering or IT/Management Consulting with a Software provider or a Consultancy. Alternatively in an inhouse role (e.g. Center of Excellence for Data Mining / Analytics / Intelligence) within an Enterprise
* Data, Analytics, Applications & IT: Good knowledge of Business Software applications and experience in using and/ or building dashboards, Apps and Action Flows. Experience in collaborating with IT teams Process Improvement & Value Realization: Experience in identifying use cases for business process improvement and deploying improvement measures, being a change agent and training users/process owners to realize value
* Project Management: Experience in planning and managing project scopes, expectations and timelines. You will manage multiple projects across your aligned accounts that will be at different parts of the value journey. Also, you will leverage partners from the Celonis Ecosystem wherever possible
* Executive Stakeholder Management: Experience in preparing and communicating (value) roadmaps and results to stakeholders and management, both internally and externally. Excellent communication and presentation skills in English (Swedish is a plus)
* Business Domain Expertise: Deep understanding of the Finance and/or Supply Chain domain as well as strategic transformation initiatives (e.g. Shared Services Transformation or System Transformation)
* Industry Expertise: Expertise in one or more industries (e.g. Manufacturing, Automotive, Consumer, Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Chemicals) and the ability to develop a deep understanding of industry trends and strategic opportunities
* Degree: in Technology & Management, Industrial/Business Engineering, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or a comparable degree program


**What Celonis can offer you:**
* The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
* Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
* Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
* Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
* A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
* An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
* Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
* A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


**About Us**
 Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world's largest and most valued companies deliver immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organisation has a common language about how the business works, visibility into where value is hidden and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich (Germany) and New York (USA) and has more than 20 offices worldwide.
   

  

 Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.
   

  

 Join us as we make processes work for people, companies and the planet.
   

  

 Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.
   

  

 Accessibility and Candidate Notices

title: Upphandlingskonsult
description:
***B3 Upphandlings målsättning är att vara Sveriges ledande konsultbolag inom IT och upphandling. Vi hjälper våra kunder genom hela inköpsprocessen från analys av verksamhetsbehov, strategiska vägval, genomförande och införande.***
 Som upphandlingskonsult hos oss kommer du att vara med i B3 leverans till offentlig sektor och du kommer att få en viktig roll med stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets och din egen utveckling.
   

  

**Rollen**
 Med din kompetens och erfarenhet hjälper du våra kunder att genomföra komplexa och omfattande upphandlingar. Du arbetar antingen på egen hand eller i team tillsammans med kollegor från våra andra dotterbolag inom B3 koncernen.
   

  

 Du bör därför vara självständig i ditt arbete, men bör också tycka om att sprida din kompetens och att arbeta tillsammans med andra. Hos oss kommer du alltid att ha ett nätverk av riktigt kompetenta kollegor att utbyta erfarenheter med!
   

  

 Rollen som upphandlingskonsult innefattar en rad olika arbetsuppgifter, som exempelvis:
   

  

* Utredningar och analyser av kunders inköpsprocesser och inköpsorganisationer
* Strategisk rådgivning i inköpsprocessen, som exempelvis att välja strategi och upphandlingsform
* Som upphandlingsprojektledare hjälpa våra kunder genom hela upphandlingsprocessen
* Kvalitetssäkring av upphandlingsdokumentation och avtal
* Utveckling och förnyelse av den offentliga verksamheten


**Kvalifikationer**
* 5 års erfarenhet i rollen som upphandlare/upphandlingskonsult med ansvar för genomförandet av komplexa upphandlingar enligt LOU/LUF
* Erfarenhet från minst ett av områdena; varor, tjänster, entreprenad


 B3 Upphandling är en del av B3 koncernen. Vi prioriterar frihet och balans i livet och har vunnit priser för vårt wellnesskoncept. Vi tror på att medarbetare som mår bra, presterar bättre och satsar därför stort på att bygga en varm, kreativ och öppen kultur i bolaget. Vi gillar att hitta på saker och arrangerar löpande olika aktiviteter, allt från cross fit till musikquiz.
   

  

 Hållbarhet är också ett ledord för oss på B3 och det gäller såväl våra sociala initiativ, som hur vi jobbar med vår viktigaste tillgång – våra medarbetare. B3 fungerar som en bas för våra konsulter där de finner stöd och får möjligheter att umgås, lära sig nya saker och bygga på kunskap.
   

  

 B3 är utsedd av Great Place to work till en av Europas bästa arbetsplatser och Sveriges bästa arbetsplats inom kategorin Large Workplaces.
   

  

**Låter det här som rätt plats för dig?** 
 Skicka in din ansökan snarast då intervjuer sker löpande. Frågor? Tveka inte att kontakta vår VD: Magnus Cronberg, 0733-210 502, magnus.cronberg@b3.se

title: Business Analyst inom bank och finans med inriktining mot Lending
description:
***Hej och välkommen till oss på Capgemini! Tillsammans skapar vi mervärde och omvandlar affärsbehov till högteknologiska IT-lösningar.***




  





**Om oss:** 




  





 Enheten
 **Financial Services** 
 är en del av en global organisation inom Capgemini. Vilket innebär att vi arbetar med kunder i Sverige men också i andra länder i Europa. I Stockholm består vårt team av drivna kollegor med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter och vi arbetar alla med de största bank- och försäkringsbolagen. Du erbjudas möjlighet att utvecklas som konsult både i lokala kundleveranser och i större globala åtaganden.
 



  





**Om rollen:** 




  





 Som
 **Business Analyst** 
 arbetar du i uppdrag hos våra kunder inom bank- och finans, till dessa hör till exempel flertalet storbanker. I våra tvärfunktionella konsultteam blir du som betrodd rådgivare länken mellan kunden och utvecklingsteamet för att säkerställa en framgångsrik implementering av Digitala lösningar. Du kommer att driva processer, kartlägga affärsbehov, formulera och definiera tekniska- samt affärskrav.
 



  





**Vi söker dig med:** 




  




* Minst 4–5 års erfarenhet som Business Analyst/Kravanalytiker med affärsförståelse inom finansbranschen.
* Erfarenhet inom konsekvensanalys samt av att omvandla affärsbehov till affärskrav.
* Erfarenhet av att dokumentera systemkrav.
* Förmåga att analytiskt hantera komplex information och att ta ägandeskap.
* Erfarenhet från bankverksamhet, processer och produkter så som lån mot privat- och företagssegmentet.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila team med verktyg så som tex JIRA eller Azure är en fördel.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, då vi har en nära dialog med våra kunder.
* Akademisk examen inom Finans, Business, IT eller motsvarande.



  





**Get the future you want:** 




  





 För oss är delaktighet och gemenskapen viktig och vi ses så ofta vi kan för gemensamma aktiviteter som lunchträffar, afterworks och kompetensutbyte. Vi hjälper dig med kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, certifieringar och intressanta kunduppdrag för en gedigen karriärutveckling. Samtidigt som vi har en nära dialog kring hur livspusslet bäst ska gå ihop.
 



  





**Ansökan:** 




  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan till oss! Vi inleder våra processer med att prata om vad du är intresserad av att göra som nästa steg och vi är genuint nyfikna över vilka faktorer som får dig att trivas på jobbet.

title: KICKS Group söker nu en System Specialist till Supply Planning teamet
description:
KICKS är Nordens ledande skönhetsaktör och är en del av Matas Group A/S. KICKS erbjuder ett holistiskt skönhetskoncept med makeup, doft, hudvård och hårvård. Med professionella skönhetsexperter och en unik omnikanal-modell erbjuder KICKS personlig service, vägledning och inspiration, och 25 000 produkter från över 300 varumärken. KICKS har 226 butiker i Sverige, Norge och Finland samt e-handel på varje marknad.
 



  





 Vår enhet Supply planning spelar en central roll i detta genom att säkerställa att rätt produkter finns tillgängliga för våra kunder både på våra butiker och online. Vi letar nu efter en systemspecialist där du kommer vara produktansvarig för vårt varustyrningssystem.
 



  





**Det här är ditt blivande jobb:** 



* Stötta den dagliga verksamheten och arbeta med operativa frågor där du omsätter verksamhetens behov till IT-lösningar och kravställningar
* Samarbeta med superusers och övriga kollegor inom supply chain för att utveckla förbättrade lösningar och säkerställa implementering
* Testa och validera ny utveckling
* Vara med och stötta med din expertis i de strategiska förflyttningarna som ska göras
* Säkerställa KPI:er och genomförande av systemimplementationer och utveckling
* Delta i crossfunktionella forum tillsammans med övriga Supply funktioner och drift



  





 Du är en viktig del i varuförsörjningskedjan och har ett nära samarbete med olika funktioner inom bolaget. Du rapporterar till Supply Planning team manager.
 



  





 I vårt team arbetar vi flexibelt men ses på kontoret i snitt tre gånger i veckan, för att skapa bästa förutsättningar och sammanhållning i teamet.
 



  





**För att du ska trivas i rollen ser vi att du har:** 



* Högskoleutbildning/universitetsexamen inom exempelvis systemvetenskap, logistik/Supply chain eller ekonomi
* Du har arbetat inom Supply chain och/eller retail i några år och du tycker om att utveckla det tekniska



  





**Utöver detta vill vi att du har:** 



* Arbetat med Relex eller motsvarande Supply chain system
* En grundläggande teknisk förståelse för olika system
* En analytisk förmåga där du utifrån utfall och tester kan göra egna bedömningar och fatta beslut när det behövs
* Förmåga att kunna bibehålla ett lugn och effektivitet under stressiga och utmanade situationer
* Ett strukturerat arbetssätt där du har en vana att prioritera för att leverera med goda resultat
* En god förmåga att skapa goda relationer både internt och externt
* Goda kunskaper i engelska i både tal och skrift



  





 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen krävs det att du är strukturerad och har god förmåga att planera och arbeta självständigt. Du är noggrann, analytisk och resultatinriktad.
 



  





 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från branscher med snabbrörliga produkter, har arbetat med processutveckling eller arbetat i gränssnittet mellan supply-chain och tech.
 



  





 Tjänsten är på heltid med placering på KICKS Group huvudkontor i centrala Stockholm.
 



  





 Är du den vi söker? Välkommen in med din ansökan redan idag. Vi intervjuar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag som är den 29 september 2024.

title: CEO to SSE Business Lab
description:
**SSE Business Lab,** 
**ranked as one of the top incubators in Europe, is looking for a new CEO. Do you want to lead the start-up incubator to further development and success? We believe you are passionate about helping motivated entrepreneurs reach their full potential and eager to lead a dynamic and impactful organization.**
 In this recruitment, we are working together with Alumni Global and would like to direct all applications and questions to Jessica Stark and her team. More information and how to apply can be found here.
   

  

**Apply**
****We offer you****
 We offer you a unique opportunity to take on a vital role in a creative and fast-moving environment where you will help build and scale multiple firms. The role offers ample opportunities to develop your own skills and abilities to take on new challenges.
   

  

 The SSE Business Lab operates as an autonomous unit within the Stockholm School of Economics (SSE) House of Innovation , and is the primary link between SSE and the Stockholm entrepreneurial ecosystem. SSE’s start-up incubator was founded in 2001 and earlier this year, the Financial Times named its track record the best in Europe. SSE Business Lab has diversity and sustainability criteria for admissions and helps its start-ups recruit in a gender-equal manner.
   

  

**About The Position**
 As the CEO, you lead and drive the
 **execution of the strategy** 
 for the Lab in its day-to-day operations. Specifically, you will oversee the programs in the incubator and ensure its alignment with the mission and vision of SSE .
   

  

 A key focus in this role is networking and matchmaking. You will be responsible for continuing to build strong connections within the start-up community and facilitating meaningful collaborations between entrepreneurs, investors, and partners. Your efforts will accelerate the growth and success of the start-ups within the SSE Business Lab.
   

  

 You will
 **lead a high-performing team** 
 comprising of a handful entrepreneurial and aspiring colleagues. Together, you work to create and nurture the best possible conditions for the start-ups across all the programs in the SSE Business Lab. You will work closely with SSE Business Lab’s fund SSE Ventures . You will also interact with several key stakeholders to the Stockholm School of Economics, such as: alums, partner networks and leading scholars.
   

  

 Across all areas of responsibility support is provided from SSE. Specifically, the strategy of the SSE Business Lab is designed and driven by the CEO with support from the Board of Directors, and major fundraising is done in close collaboration with SSE’s unit for Corporate and Donor Relations, and with the House of Innovation.
   

  

****Profile****
**We Believe You Are Someone Who**
* Is at least 5-10 years into your career.
* Is a strategic thinker, and a great problem solver with an entrepreneurial mindset who thrives in a fast-paced environment.
* Thrives in social settings, has excellent communications and interpersonal relationship-building skills, and possesses the ability to create strong professional relationships at all levels.
* Is a confident leader who motivates others and can engage employees toward common goals.
* Is driven and responsible and can turn visions into reality, with a growth-oriented focus to continue to develop the organization.
* Believes in SSE’s vision and mission , and specifically holds a passion for equality, diversity and sustainability.


**Qualifications**
* Hands-on entrepreneurship experience, either through own start-up journey(s) and/or extensive exposure to start-ups through incubators, accelerators, or as an investor to be able to support and assess early-stage companies.
* Established network within the entrepreneurial ecosystem, including venture capital funds, angel investors and other incubators/accelerators. It is beneficial to also have a strong international network.
* Demonstrated experience in personnel and budget management, with a proven track record of leading teams, preferably young professionals.
* Excellent communication skills to be able to act as a spokesperson, handling interviews, lectures, and visits with confidence and reliability.
* Proficient in navigating complex processes with strong diplomatic skills, but also has the courage and integrity to question and stand firm.
* Fluent in English, both oral and written.
* Bachelor's degree in business administration, or related field


**Apply** 
****About the SSE Business Lab****
 The SSE Business Lab is the start-up incubator of the Stockholm School of Economics, operating as an autonomous unit in the SSE House of Innovation. The Business Lab’s mission is to strengthen Sweden’s competitiveness by providing a platform for growth to exceptional entrepreneurs. Key values include commitment to diversity, inclusion, and sustainability; a passion for community; and the courage to be bold.
   

  

 The SSE Business Lab encourages entrepreneurship amongst students, alums, and faculty, and helps start-ups develop their ideas, accelerate their growth, and create a positive impact through coaching, mentorship, workshops, and access to a first-class network of investors.
   

  

 The incubator provides access to a wide variety of partner offers from organizations like Microsoft for Start-ups, Scrive, PE Accounting, and Grosshandelssocieteten as part of Stockholms Borgerskap.
   

  

 Since its inception in 2001, SSE Business Lab has supported over 300 companies – among them notable successes like Klarna, Budbee, and Voi Technology. In 2022, the SSE Business Lab launched its investment fund: SSE Ventures.
   

  

**About The Stockholm School Of Economics**
 The Stockholm School of Economics is ranked as the top business school in the Nordic and Baltic countries and enjoys a very strong international reputation. World-class research forms the foundation of our educational offering, which includes Bachelor, Master, Ph.D., MBA, and Executive Education programs. Through creativity and collaboration, the Stockholm School of Economics provides an environment where ambitious students and accomplished researchers meet to address contemporary business and economics challenges, particularly sustainability, diversity, and innovation.
   

  

 Apart from delivering world-class education in business and economics, SSE students are trained to be successful decision-makers and leaders of tomorrow.
   

  

 SSE is committed to a balanced gender distribution and values various backgrounds and experiences among our employees. Therefore, we welcome all applicants regardless of their gender, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, disability, sexual orientation, age, religion, or other beliefs.

title: Systemarkitekt med gedigen erfarenhet
description:
Vi söker en erfaren säkerhetsarkitekt med en gedigen erfarenhet inom IT infrastruktur, tekniska säkerhetslösningar med fokus på arkitektur och design. I din roll kommer du vara en nyckelperson i att hjälpa kunder med säkerhetsstrategier och säkerhetsgranskningar.
 



  





**Ansvarsområden** 




 - Utveckla och implementera robusta IT-säkerhetslösningar med arkitektur som är anspassade efter kundens specifika behov.
 



 - Genomföra risk- och säkerhetskgranskningar tillsammans med förslag på förbättringar.
 



 - Vara delaktig i projekt och upphandlingar som säkerhetsarkitekt och designa helhetslösningar.
 



 - Samarbeta med kunder och hjälpa dem i deras arbete med efterlevnad till gällande säkerhetsstandard och regulatoriska krav.
 



  





**Din erfarenhet** 




 - Gedigen erfarenhet som IT-Säkerhetsarkitekt med fokus på tekniska lösningar.
 



 - Bakgrund inom IT-infrastruktur, inklusive server, storage och nätverk.
 



 - Kompetens inom Cloud Säkerhet och förmågan att implementera säkerhetskontroller i cloud miljöer.
 



 - Erfarenhet av informationssäkerhet och IT-säkerhet på operationell, taktisk och strategisk nivå.
 



 - Kompetens av regulatoriska krav som NIS Direktivet, GDPR, MSBFS, Dora m fl.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer för rollen** 




 - Bachelor's Degree i IT eller relaterat område.
 



 - Relevanta certifieringar som CISSP, CISM, CEH, OCP, CCSP.
 



 - Gedigen erfarenhet inom IT-säkerhetsarkitektur, IT-Infrastruktur och Cloud Security kompetens.
 



 - Erfarenhet av ramverk och metoder som NIST CSF, CIS18, ISO 2700x, ITIL v3, STRIDE och MITRE ATT&CK.
 



 - Erfarenhet av administration och projektarbete som kravanalys, Disaster Recovery och kontinuitetsplanering.
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 - Analytiskt tänkande och problemlösningsförmånga.
 



 - Nogrann och fokus på detaljer.
 



 - Förmåga att arbeta bra på egen hand men även med grupp.
 



 - Utmärk förmåga till samarbete och kommunikation.
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Vi på Softronic jobbar ständigt med att förﬂytta våra kunder mot morgondagens teknik. Vare sig det handlar om att utveckla AI, automatisera processer eller modernisera en äldre lösning med bibehållen tillgänglighet. En annan sida av det vi gör är att vi hjälper våra kunder att utveckla innovativa och driftsäkra tjänster som skapar samhällsnytta genom att förenkla människors liv och jobb. På så sätt blir vi och vår teknik en positiv kraft i samhället och en del i att göra världen lite mer hållbar. Det är det vi kallar GoodTech.
 



 Vi ser arbetet och arbetsplatsen som en av flera energigivande delar i människans liv. Därför odlar vi aktivt en kultur av gemenskap och lust, där brädspelskvällar, löprundor med kollegorna längs vattnet eller en ﬁka på terrassen är viktigt och ska få lov att ta plats. Genom gemenskap och samhörighet blir det också enklare att tillsammans vidareutveckla våra förmågor, för att i förlängningen kunna vässa vårt erbjudande mot våra kunder.
 



  





**Kontakt** 




 Varmt välkommen att kontakta Linda Nyberg på linda.nyberg@softronic.se för mer information.
 



 Vi har valt media, säljsamtal undanbedes.
 



*Bakgrundskontroll kommer utföras vid rekryteringen.*

title: Product Owner för Microsoft 365 hos Retail Solutions
description:
Är du redo att revolutionera butikens upplevelse med hjälp av teknik? Har du en talang för att lösa komplexa utmaningar och en passion för digitala verktyg? Vi letar efter en dynamisk och driven Product Owner som vill ta täten och optimera användning av Microsoft 365 i butiker över hela landet.
   

  

**Det här är ditt blivande jobb**
 Som Product Owner kommer du att ha en central roll i att säkerställa att våra butiksanställda har de verktyg och förmågor inom MS365 de behöver för att arbeta smartare och effektivare. Du tillhör Produktteamet som ansvarar för butikernas användarupplevelse och du kommer att arbeta nära andra Product Owners för att skapa en fantastisk butiksupplevelse.
   

  

 Nedan följer en detaljerad arbetsbeskrivning för rollen:
   

  

* Strategisk planering: Du kommer att arbeta nära butikerna och övriga Product Owners för att förstå ICAs övergripande strategi och affärsmål. Utifrån dessa mål ska du utforma en strategi för hur MS365 ska användas i butik.
* Verktygsutvärdering och val: Din uppgift är att utvärdera befintliga MS365-funktioner och identifiera nya möjligheter. Vilka verktyg är mest relevanta för butiksanvändning? Dessutom ska du säkerställa att butikerna kan köpa de licenser som krävs.
* Implementering och utbildning: Du ansvarar för att utrullning och implementation av MS365 görs genom den delen av organisationen som specifikt arbetar med detta.
* Säkerhet och efterlevnad: Tillsammans med koncernens plattformsägare ska du se till att vi har de säkerhetsmekanismer på plats som ICA kräver, samt att dataklassificering följs.
* Integration med andra system: Utforska möjligheter att integrera MS365 med andra butikssystem, såsom exempelvis MinButik.
* Support och problemlösning: Du kommer vara övergripande ansvarig för att det finns support för vår butikspersonal när det gäller MS365-relaterade frågor och problem.


**Är du den vi söker?**
 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen krävs det att du:
   

  

* Har stort intresse för ny teknik och automation
* Har starkt eget driv och är initiativtagande att skapa effekt, framdrift och resultat
* Brinner för att sätta sig in i butikernas vardag och förstå deras utmaningar på kort och lång sikt
* Levererar resultat genom att definiera smarta mål och har förmågan att bryta ned det i planer på lång och kort sikt
* Kan växla mellan ett strategiskt, visionärt perspektiv och ett mer operativt fokus


 Formella krav och erfarenheter:
   

  

* Relevant akademisk utbildning; ingenjör, ekonom, systemvetare eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av verksamhetsutveckling
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av att leda agil utveckling eller projekt inom mjukvaruutveckling
* Utmärkta kunskaper inom Microsoft 365 för samverkan, presentation, kalkyl m.m.
* Svenska och engelska obehindrat i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du:
   

  

* Har kunskap om Atlassians verktyg Jira, Jira Product Discovery och Confluence
* Tidigare har genomfört projekt inom IT, digitalisering och/eller automation
* Jobbat i eller mot dagligvaruhandel i Sverige
* Verkat i en stor organisation med många stakeholders


 Personliga egenskaper:
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en strategisk tänkare med ett starkt kundorienterat mindset som brinner för utveckling och förbättringar. Personen vi söker ska vara anpassningsbar till föränderliga affärsbehov och tekniska landskap. En god kommunikatör som är skicklig på att förmedla idéer och information tydligt och effektivt. Dessutom analytisk och strukturerad, vilket hjälper till att lösa komplexa problem och fatta välgrundade beslut.
   

  

**Därför ska du välja ICA**
 Ser du också möjligheterna med digital innovation? Vi tycker att det är bland det bästa som hänt vår bransch. För det gör att vi kan förenkla vardagen för så många människor därute. I nära samarbeten med varandra, för att verkligen kunna maximera allas individuella insatser i varje utmaning vi möter, skapar vi riktig kundnytta. Oavsett om vi jobbar med IT inom banktjänster, fastigheter eller kring all vår goda mat är vi nära kundens vardag. Och vi driver den digitala utvecklingen framåt inom våra olika områden. Varje dag.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Är du den vi söker? Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och personligt brev. Sista dag för ansökan är 13 september. Intervjuer och tillsättning görs löpande.
   

  

**Kontaktperson**
 Rekryterande chef, Peter Johansson, peter.h.johansson@ica.se
   

  

 ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Vi värnar om goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden med mål om helt rökfria arbetsplatser. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.

title: First Line Manager - Diagnostic Enablement and Verification (EYSDB)
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

**What We Do**
 We at Vehicle Service Information (EYS) are passionate about Uptime and Serviceability, as well as allowing our workshops to be best in class in supporting our customers when they come in for a workshop visit.
   

  

 Daily, 16,000 Mechanics maintain, troubleshoot and repair Scania vehicles and engines worldwide, so it is very important to quickly diagnose and repair vehicles to get the customer back on the road again.
   

  

 At the group, Diagnostic Enablement and Verification (EYSDB), we handle the delivery and verify the quality of the aftermarket support system needed to troubleshoot, maintain and repair vehicles. We are also responsible for enabling the production of new diagnostic content.
   

  

 To succeed in our mission we have a deep collaboration with various development and service departments and our goal is to ensure that we have great quality and are releasing the right functionality at the right time to make our products service-friendly, efficient and safe to work with.
   

  

**Your Assignment**
 You will lead and build up a new group starting with 7 employees consisting of Test Managers, Configuration Managers and Software Developers.
   

  

 The group's responsibilities will be to verify and ensure the quality of our complete customer delivery of our service market systems and also enabling our diagnostic content creators to deliver in an efficient way. To achieve this you will need to define how you want your team to work and recruit more testing personnel
   

  

 The role requires that you can lead your team in building new processes and solving technical problems with a customer-centric perspective.
   

  

 As group manager at EYSDB, you are a part of the EYSD management team and will contribute to the development of the entire department. Our way of working in the management team is permeated by openness, dialogue and a willingness to help each other to succeed together. We look forward to having you contribute with your opinions and experiences in that spirit.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 We are looking for someone who has a great commitment to lead the development of both personnel and operations.
   

  

  

* You have positive attitude and find it engaging to encounter challenges and new creative solutions.
* In your work, you will have extensive cross-functional collaboration where communication skills are important.
* As a manager, you are engaged and know that feedback and transparency is key to build a great team.
* You can achieve good results together with others and feel comfortable to delegate.
* You have a master’s degree in engineering or IT
* You write and speak fluently in English and Swedish
* A background in automotive and/or embedded systems test and development is a merit


**What We Offer**
 A flexible work environment with a hybrid where we expect you to be at the office at least 3 days a week.
   

  

 We can also offer other benefits such as free Training at Scania’s facility in Södertälje or wellness allowance, performance bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced price, the opportunity for a staff car and much more.
   

  

**Further information**
 For more information contact Daniel Ahlberg, Senior Manager of Service Products Development, +46855353774
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 15 September 2024. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!
   

  

 Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2022, we delivered 80,238 trucks, 4,994 buses as well as 13,400 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 170 billion, of which 21 percent were services related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 57,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com

title: Lifecycle Marketing Analyst
description:
Our vision is to transform presentations, meetings and lectures by turning passive audiences into engaged contributors. We make this possible through our interactive presentation platform where the traditional presentation monologue becomes an inclusive dialogue. We believe in the power of together and that the most successful leaders listen to be heard.
   

  

 With Mentimeter, users become the best presenter they can be. Meetings become more productive, participants learn more and have fun whilst doing it.
   

  

 We have more than 300 million users and customers worldwide, on our way of making the world a better place, one presentation at a time.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Lifecycle Marketing Analyst at Mentimeter, you play a crucial role in optimizing our lifecycle marketing communication strategies to boost user engagement and conversion rates. This position is ideal for someone who excels in a data-driven environment and are committed to improving the user and customer lifecycle journeys through insightful analytics. Your expertise in analyzing key metrics and indicators will drive data-informed decision-making and contribute to the overall success of our Lifecycle Marketing team.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Develop insights: Continuously collect and analyze user data, integrating communication engagement metrics with product usage and account-specific data to enhance our understanding of user and customer behaviors across different lifecycle stages.
* Optimize communication: Employ a data-oriented approach to initiate testing and experimentation. Together with Marketing Automation Managers create hypotheses, segment identification, and trigger points for effective communication. Utilize analytics to evaluate campaign performance, refine user engagement strategies, and propose areas for enhancement.
* Support decision-making: Track and report on the performance of all lifecycle marketing communications, providing visual and actionable insights to key stakeholders across Marketing, Product and Sales teams. Develop and refine KPI frameworks within the Lifecycle Marketing team that align with Mentimeter’s strategic goals.
* Cross-functional collaboration: Forge strong connections with colleagues across Marketing, Data analytics, Product, and Sales to ensure a unified understanding of the user and customer experience throughout their lifecycle.


 This role reports to our Lifecycle Marketing Manager.
   

  

**We Believe You Have**
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in analytics, preferably within lifecycle marketing and marketing automation.
* A strong foundation in data analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization, translating complex data into actionable insights.
* Proven ability to work collaboratively across various teams in a fast-paced environment.
* A proactive mindset with meticulous attention to detail.
* Proficiency with marketing automation tools (e.g. Braze, customer.io , Iterable, Salesforce Marketing Cloud) and BI tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau)
* Prior experience in a SaaS environment, especially within a product-led growth model, is highly desirable.


**Apply today and join the team at Mentimeter!**
 At Mentimeter where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications?
   

  

 Apply anyway and let us know why you would enjoy working in this particular role at Mentimeter!
   

  

 Please note that this role will have its base in our
 **Stockholm** 
**office** 
 and is primarily an onsite role with the opportunity to work from home twice per week.
   

  

 Click here to learn more about Our Ways of Working - Guiding Principles.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
* Alva Labs tests - conduct a personality and logical ability test as part of the screening process
* Introduction interview - Meet TA rep for introduction interview
* Business Case - Conduct a business case showcasing your skills, knowledge and core competencies
* Competence interview - Meet the team in an onsite deep-dive interview
* Culture interview - Reflect more about our 5 core values and why you would be a great fit at Mentimeter


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Once a year we also relocate to exciting places all over the world like Merida & Buenos Aires for our Toronto colleagues, cities in Europe (for our Stockholm colleagues), and cities in APAC (for our Sydney colleagues), paid for by us of course. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page .
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Head of Fraud Prevention, Financial Crime Prevention, SEB | Stockholm
description:
With a long and proven track record, SEB is recognized as a leading northern-European financial services group with a strong foundation of customers ranging from private individuals to large organizations. We are consistently recognized for our expertise and customer-centric approach, which we achieve by listening to our clients, committing to quality and trust, and encouraging an entrepreneurial mindset in everything that we do.
   

  

 The Financial Crime Prevention (FCP) function is driving the deployment of advanced financial crime prevention capabilities to continuously meet regulatory expectations and to be at the forefront of fighting financial crime.
   

  

 We are currently looking for a Head of Fraud Prevention to join the Fraud Management team within the FCP function.
   

  

**About The Job**
 SEB’s fraud prevention efforts are aimed at protecting SEB customers and the bank against fraud and at the same time collaborate with external actors to mitigate the fraud seen in the society.
   

  

 SEB has a central Fraud Management organization that works with fraud prevention, detection, and response. As Head of Fraud Prevention, you will lead a highly motivated and top-performing team of fraud prevention and detection specialists and be part of the Fraud Management leader team. Your main responsibility will be to drive and facilitate the fraud prevention and detection agenda and to drive change initiatives to further accelerate SEB's target to be best-in-class within the fraud prevention space. Collaboration with relevant business areas and other financial crimes teams as well as external actors are part of the core tasks.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 We are looking for an individual who is open, engaged and curious, paired together with a strong interest in people and in different perspectives. You probably have a couple of years of relevant experience working on financial crime-related issues, preferably within the fraud realm, and as such have created a deep understanding of the underlying methods to efficiently prevent and detect fraud. Additionally, you have a good understanding of a bank’s ecosystem of products and services, which guides you in what is most important from a fraud perspective. Furthermore, you work actively to create an inclusive and engaging work environment for you, your team, and your peers, alongside driving a communicative and feedback-driven culture. Also:
   

  

* You are comfortable and enjoy presenting to various audiences in both English and Swedish
* You have a very high sense of integrity, as the role is exposed to sensitive information
* You are a genuine team player and derive energy from a dynamic way of working


**What We Offer**
 SEB offers an attractive and international environment where we strive to adapt to agile and modern ways of working. You will work side by side with experienced colleagues from different parts of the organization and get the chance to build a strong network internally as well as externally.
   

  

 SEB promotes a flexible and healthy work culture. We recognize that the wellbeing of our colleagues is closely related to our ability to have fun and perform together. Among other things, our team has the option to work remotely 2 days a week.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
**www.sebgroup.com/career**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where
 **they come from.**
**Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.**
**Application details**
 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute as Head of Fraud Prevention and to the Fraud Management unit.
   

  

 Candidates will be reviewed and selected on an ongoing basis, and you are welcome to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than the 1st of September. Should you have any questions regarding the position you can reach out to Anna Granqvist, at anna.granqvist@seb.se or Olga Wohlfahrt, Talent Acquisition Partner, at olga.wohlfahrt@seb.se .
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Associate Analytics Director I Candy Crush Saga
description:
**Craft:**
 Data, Analytics & Strategy
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for a talented Associate Analytics Director, with a passion for product and game development, to push and deeply understand the performance of our game economy as part of the Candy Crush Saga team. You will get the opportunity to be part of a great team, working with an industry leading and genre defining game with over 200 million active players.
   

  

 Your Role Within the Kingdom
   

  

 As the Associate Analytics Director, you will spearhead efforts to analyze and optimize our game’s live in-app purchases (IAP) and offer portfolio. Collaborating with Product Managers, Designers, and Engineers, you will not only analyze existing data but also innovate and guide implementation of solutions to enhance player engagement and business performance. Your expertise in product analytics will be crucial in generating strategic insights that propel Candy Crush Saga to new heights.
   

  

 In your capacity as a people manager, you will exemplify best practices and foster a culture of continuous improvement and professional growth within the analytics team. You will also co-manage our analytical experimentation processes, ensuring actionable insights and consistent reporting on business and strategic progress, aiding in informed decision-making.
   

  

 Key responsibilities:
   

  

 Experimentation loop, business performance & strategy
   

  

* Drive in-game experimentation to improve business performance together with the product manager and analysts by identifying opportunities and testing via A/B tests
* Assist leadership in shaping strategic initiatives and setting the strategic direction for the product area based on insights.
* Maintain and improve the reporting process and format for business performance and experimentation.
* Collaborate with central analytics teams and other leaders to establish best practices for analyzing key business drivers.


 Develop our analysts by setting them up for success
   

  

* Manage and lead analysts to achieve objectives, defining analytics scope and coordinating people across the area.
* Provide analysts opportunities to grow their skills and careers in King and help to foster their professional development.
* Ensure the availability of necessary resources in collaboration with stakeholders to fulfill the analytics roadmap and maximize team potential.


 Help guide and contribute to work as a senior craft representative
   

  

* Actively contribute analytical expertise to product streams within the area, driving key insights and action.
* Promote advanced analytical methods and frameworks to enhance product quality and user experience.
* Own analytics projects, integrating needs into development roadmaps.
* Foster growth within and across crafts, promoting leadership development and supporting craft-related forums and initiatives.


**Skills To Create Thrills**
* Proven experience in a B2C commercial setting, utilizing data-driven insights for topline performance improvements, preferably in strategy, management consulting, or pricing.
* Demonstrated leadership abilities with a proactive approach to learning and collaboration in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong communication skills with a track record of effectively translating analytical insights to diverse teams.
* Masters’ or PhD Degree, or equivalent industry experience, in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics. Economics, Engineering or similar fields.
* Highly proficient in SQL as well as sufficient skills in Python or R, known work experience in numerical analysis, project management, experimentation, and advanced reporting methodologies that can help you guide the team.


 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
   

  

**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: SBA-/Brandskyddssamordnare
description:
Som SBA-/Brandskyddssamordnare planerar och utvecklar du SBA-arbetet i organisationen. Det är viktigt att du kan kontrollera och drifta brandlarms- och sprinkleranläggning samt förstå hur de olika systemen samverkar med fastighetens övriga system. Du ansvarar för månadskontroller och kvartalsprover för brandlarm samt sprinkler och för att styrdokumentbrandskydd följs.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har goda kunskaper inom relevanta lagar och regelverk, särskilt lagen om skydd mot olyckor. Goda kunskaper inom relevanta IT-system och Office är också viktigt då du är systemansvarig för L&T:s SBA-system.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Vidareutbildning enligt SBF:s utbildning ”brandskyddsledare 1” eller motsvarande
* Gymnasieutbildning med yrkesexamen eller med högskolebehörighet.
* Minst ha svenska brandskydds-föreningens utbildning ”egenkontroll” eller liknande.
* Utbildning föreståndare brandfarlig vara
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet och minst 5 års fördjupad kunskap inom brandskyddsarbete, gärna inom vårdmiljö. Erfarenhet av att planera och följa upp brandskyddsarbete.
* God svenska i tal och skrift.
* B-Körkort.


**Meriterande**
* Heta Arbeten, Fallskydd, Första hjälpen, Anläggningsskötare brandlarm och sprinkler
* Grundläggande kunskaper i ABFF/AFF


 Vi söker en SBA samordnare som vill bidra i ett engagerat team om totalt ca 15 medarbetare som med driftuppdrag för våra två sjukhus som ligger i norra Stockholm. Vi satsar mycket på lagutveckling och utbildningar då sjukhus är en strategisk del av vår verksamhet.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Vi gör löpande urval och intervjuer och önskar därför få din ansökan så snart som möjligt. När du skickat in din ansökan får du ett bekräftelsemail.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta platschef Patrik Heikkilä på telefonnummer 0730 756 014
   

  

*Vi undanber oss all kontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av jobbannonser.*

title: Säljare
description:
Får du energi av att bygga relationer och har du ett intresse för kundhantering och försäljning? Har du tålamod och en förmåga att hantera processer som varierar i tid? Då kommer du trivas i rollen som säljare hos oss!
   

  

*Hos oss får du tryggheten i att vara en del av ett stort företag med kollektivavtal samt goda utvecklingsmöjligheter i en kultur som präglas av Driv, Integritet och Hållbarhet. Vi erbjuder många uppskattade personalrabatter och förmåner samt ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag eftersom vi värnar om våra anställdas hälsa och välbefinnande. Du får dessutom möjligheten att jobba i en verksamhet med skickliga kollegor och god stämning. Läs gärna mer på vår karriärsida.*
**Om tjänsten**
 Som säljare hos oss på Volkswagen Kista blir ditt främsta ansvar att bearbeta och utveckla såväl nya som befintliga kundkontakter. Du kommer att vara kundens kontakt genom hela processen och även ge kundstöd efter avslutat köp. Du kommer se till att våra kunder alltid blir utomordentligt bemötta under sin kontakt med oss samt även att den planerade volymen för sålda bilar uppnås. Tillsammans med dina kollegor kommer du att ansvara för bilarna i säljhallen, demonstrationsbilarna samt annonsering av bilarna på nätet.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För den här tjänsten ser vi dig med minst två års dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete med kunder, relationsbyggande och kundservice. Detta har gett dig goda kunskaper i vad en nöjd kund och en bra kundupplevelse innebär. Du förstår vikten av att ge dina kunder en trygg köpupplevelse med oss.
   

  

 Vi ser även att du genom erfarenhet fått insikt i att försäljningsprocesser kan ta olika lång tid, vilket innebär ett behov av gott tålamod.
   

  

 Har du även arbetat med proaktiv uppsökandeförsäljning ser vi det som en fördel.
   

  

 Utöver detta är det viktigt att du har en förmåga att sätta dig in i nya IT-system och du hanterar administrativa arbetsuppgifter med kvalitet. I rollen som säljare behöver du dessutom ett B-körkort.
   

  

**Det här utmärker dig**
 För att trivas i rollen som säljare är du en ambitiös person som gillar att arbeta mot individuella mål. Därtill få du energi i mötet med kunder och tycker om att hjälpa dina kunder hitta rätt vid deras bilköp. Vidare har du en hög arbetsmoral samt en förmåga att ta initiativ för att hitta nya kunder och möjliga affärer. Du är därtill en teamorienterad person och har en positiv inställning där du är med och bidrar till en god arbetsmiljö i teamet.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper då gruppens dynamik är avgörande för att produktionen skall nå uppsatta mål.
   

  

 Din Bil eftersträvar jämställdhet och mångfald. Vi värdesätter det kvaliteter som en jämn könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Din Bil Sverige genomför enligt gällande rekryteringsprocess i samtliga rekryteringar en kontroll av CV/Meritförteckning, vitsord och vandelsprövning innan anställning.
   

  

 Skicka din ansökan snarast då urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före
 **sista ansökningsdag, 30 september 2024.**
 Rekryterande chef, Daniel Olsson.
   

  

 Facklig representant Unionen, Ian Elezovic 08-503 332 84
   

  

**VÄLKOMMEN MED DIN ANSÖKAN!**

title: Group FP&A and Treasury Manager
description:
**About Us** 




 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and 4Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
 



 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead
 



  

**About the role**




 We are seeking a candidate with a strategy consulting background, ideally with approximately 2 years of experience from a top-tier consulting firm and potentially Business Control (or a related field) within a fast-paced industry or tech company. The new recruit will work closely with our Head of Group FP&A and Treasury in building our Treasury function from the ground up, as well as to continue building and developing our Group FP&A function. This role provides a chance to join one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies, focusing on high-priority strategic topics, such as enabling suitable financing for our growth journey. You will gain considerable exposure to the organization, including direct interactions with senior management. It's an excellent opportunity for a driven individual eager to make a significant impact in a dynamic and rapidly evolving environment.
 



  

**Your key responsibilities**




 As the Group FP&A and Treasury Manager you will be a pivotal member of the Finance department and work specifically with building our Treasury and Group FP&A functions.
   





**The responsibilities of these functions include:** 



* Treasury Optimizing net working capital Lead projects aimed at improving the company’s cash position.
* Forecasting cash flow.
* Overseeing the planning and execution of capital expenditures, ensuring alignment with strategic priorities and financial capacity.
* Group FP&A Handling annual planning and coordination of reporting, business planning, forecasting etc.
* Consolidating and quality assuring financial reports and budgets/forecasts.
* Managing the FP&A collaboration forum and spearheading continuous improvement initiatives.
* Collaborating with Business Controllers to develop and implement FP&A best practices, including standardized definitions, tools and process improvements.
* Leading digital transformation initiatives to enhance analytical capabilities and streamline reporting.



  

**About you**




 We believe you possess the following qualities:
 


* Exceptional motivation and drive.
* Outstanding analytical skills.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.



**More about you**



* Approximately 2 years of experience in strategy consulting and business control (or related field).
* Degree in business administration, engineering, or related field.
* Experience in a fast-paced industry and/or tech company is highly advantageous.



  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
 


* Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
* Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
* Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
   

 and love to your little one.
* A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!



  





*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.*

title: SAP IBP Architect
description:
Our SAP Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for a SAP IBP Architect to join the team to build, support, and drive customer innovations and workflow improvements, bringing efficiency to the processes through efficient management of cost and schedule. If you want to grow and build the foundation on the S4 Hana platform working across multiple customers, look no further.
 



  





 In alignment with Avigna's values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.
 



  





 Experience: 10+ years
 



 Location: Sweden
 



 Mode of work: hybrid
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




 Design and architect end-to-end SAP IBP solutions, including Demand Planning, Supply Planning, Inventory Optimization, and S&OP (Sales and Operations Planning) processes.
 



 Lead the implementation of SAP IBP solutions, including requirement gathering, blueprinting, configuration, testing, and go-live support.
 



 Customize and optimize IBP modules to align with the client’s specific business requirements and processes.
 



 Ensure seamless integration of SAP IBP with other SAP modules (e.g., SAP ECC, SAP S/4HANA) and third-party systems.
 



 Collaborate closely with key stakeholders, including business leaders, IT teams, and external vendors, to ensure alignment of IBP solutions with business goals.
 



 Provide training and support to end-users, ensuring effective adoption of IBP tools and processes.
 



 Develop comprehensive documentation, including solution designs, functional specifications, and user manuals.
 



 Stay updated with the latest trends and updates in SAP IBP and drive continuous improvement initiatives within the IBP landscape.
 



  





**Key Requirements:** 




 A minimum of 8 years of experience in SAP IBP, with hands-on expertise in IBP modules like Demand Planning, Supply Planning, and S&OP.
 



 Proficient in SAP IBP configuration, customization, and integration with other SAP systems. Strong understanding of data modeling, forecasting techniques, and optimization algorithms.
 



 Demonstrated experience in leading SAP IBP implementation projects, from planning to execution, within stipulated timelines and budgets.
 



 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex IBP concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 



 SAP IBP certification is an added advantage.
 



 Proficiency in English is required.

title: Product Compliance Advisor
description:
**Product Safety and Compliance Advisor to DeLaval**
 Would you like the opportunity to work for a company that is the worldwide leader in high technology milking equipment for dairy farmers? Are you a social person and like to work with different kind of persons to improve their daily work? Are you a becoming star in Global Market Access for products?
   

  

 DeLaval is now looking for a Product Safety and Compliance Advisor that will be part of the Product Compliance team and strengthen the product safety and compliance competence within the company.
   

  

 The role as Product Compliance Advisor is challenging and cross-functional, enabling personal growth and development. It is a great opportunity for you to expand your horizons and contribute to product safety in a company with an exciting and diverse, high technology assortment for dairy industries and farmers, robots, big machinery, radio devices, control systems, milking rotaries and more.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Your main responsibility will be to support DeLaval product development with safety related requirements for products, you need also to support product management to follow the internal compliance related processes, procedures, and guidelines and general product quality management. You will daily interact with internal stakeholders such as Engineers, Project Managers, Product Managers and Sourcing Managers.
   

  

 As a Product Compliance Advisor, you report to the Product Compliance Manager within the Quality and Compliance department at DeLaval.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Keep an updated knowledge of relevant legislations and standard changes in DeLaval global markets. Analyze effects of regulatory changes and provide guidance on how to reach/maintain compliance for DeLaval product assortment.
* Maintain the internal Product Compliance library by keeping guidelines and checklists up to date according to relevant regulations.
* Support product development, sourcing, and product owners in compliance matters.
* Conduct training for product development, sourcing, and product owners in product regulatory matters.


**Qualifications And Experience**
 To thrive in the role of Product Compliance Advisor you should have:
   

  

* A university degree within electrical- or mechanical engineering or an equivalent, practical experience in supporting an international manufacturer as Delaval International.
* A genuine interest for the connection between technology, standards, legal requirements and innovation.
* An understanding of conformity assessments work related to EU regulations for CE marking as a minimum, a knowledge about global product regulations and markets access requirement is a plus.
* An understanding for the technical requirements (product safety standards) related to legal regulations and the challenges for our stakeholders to fulfill them in their daily work.


**Our offer**
 We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. You will have an interesting and meaningful job with possibilities to make a difference for food production sustainability. An atmosphere built on trust, support, and mutual respect.
   

  

**Practical information**
* Start: As soon as possible
* Work extent: Full time
* Location: Tumba, Stockholm


 If you are interested in joining our team, please apply online with your CV and cover letter at the latest 9 September. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Medical Advisor, Respiratory, Sweden
description:
**Medical Advisor Immunology Respiratory Sweden**
* Location: Sweden


**About The Job**
**Our team:**
 New opportunity as a Medical Advisor in the specialty care immunology medical affairs team. In this role you will implement the medical and scientific (non-promotional) strategy for the Immunology Respiratory therapeutic area and other key medical affairs initiatives primarily in the field in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, in alignment with the immunology North Europe medical strategy,and according to the highest ethical and compliance standards. You will join a high performing team with a can-do attitude to create and to deliver value to HCPs and patients.
   

  

 This is a local role with field based work. Travel is expected in the country in scope and occasional travel within the Nordic and North Europe region.
   

  

**Main responsibilities:**
* Identify, develop and maintain collaboration with current and future Key Opinion Leaders.
* Regular external scientific/medical presentations, e.g. scientific conferences, high-level scientific or business audiences.
* Maintain and develop strong relationships with local scientific societies and central decision makers at relevant health authorities.
* Drive organization and implementation of Advisory Boards and other scientific meetings.
* Oversee and interpret new scientific data, literature, competitive trends and opportunities and adjust medical and educational activities accordingly.
* Support local market access medical alignment and new indication launch preparation.
* Be proactive and active contributor to the cross functional local brand plan, dossiers etc.


**About You**
**Experience** 
 :
   

  

* Pharmaceutical industry experience, experience from a similar position / experience within therapeutic area is a plus.
* Experience in communication with medical authorities, hospitals, physicians /specialists and KOLs as well as other healthcare sector professionals. Experience in interpretation and dissemination of scientific and clinical data.


**Soft skills:**
* Team player and strong interpersonal skills.
* High initiative and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to coordinate, manage and prioritize resources and workload in a busy professional environment.
* Strategic mind-set whilst being target-oriented and results-driven, with an understanding of short- and long-term goals.
* Balanced, yet structured, and fast in decision making processes.
* Professional and mature projection, and self-confident behavior.


**Education** 
 :
   

  

* At least Master level degree in medicine or other life science; a PhD degree in medicine, or other life science, Pharmacist or MD degree are seen as a plus.


**Languages** 
 :
   

  

* Business proficiency in English, local language native speaker.


**Why choose us?**
* Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team.
* Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally.
* Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact.
* Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and gender-neutral parental leave.


**Pursue
 *progress* 
 . Discover
 *extraordinary* 
 .**
 Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.
   

  

 At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.
